intro: Lingoum echinatum, commonly known as the spiked bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, spiky fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
